paper_abstract: We present families of unital algebras obtained through a doubling process from a cyclic central simple algebra D = (K/F, sigma, c), employing a K-automorphism tau and an element d is an element of D-X. These algebras appear in the construction of iterated space-time block codes. We give conditions when these iterated algebras are division which can be used to construct fully diverse iterated codes. We also briefly look at algebras (and codes) obtained from variations of this method.
paper_title: HOW TO OBTAIN DIVISION ALGEBRAS USED FOR FAST-DECODABLE SPACE-TIME BLOCK CODES
